description.narrative: 1.1. networking & dialogue - EMHRN members and other relevant CSOs participate in bi-annual working group meetings, define political priorities of EMHRN regional work, formulate joint strategies and implement joint initiatives on most pressing human rights issues in key thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

1.1. networking & dialogue - EMHRN members and other relevant CSOs participate in bi-annual working group meetings, define political priorities of EMHRN regional work, formulate joint strategies and implement joint initiatives on most pressing human rights issues in key thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Local HROs, i.e. EMHRN members and partners, have an expressed need to liaise with others on key thematic issues for the region in a continuous way to engaging and mobilising with CSOs in the Euro-Med region to dialogue and provide regional civil society responses to issues of national and regional concern.

description.narrative: 1.2. capacity-building - HRO/Ds have enhanced capacities to advocate, monitor, document and engage in actions relevant to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.
1.2. capacity-building - HRO/Ds have enhanced capacities to advocate, monitor, document and engage in actions relevant to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

comment.narrative: HROs in the Euro-Med region have expressed the need for increased capacity on advocacy, monitoring/documentation on key thematic areas in order to enhance their impact of their work in these areas.

description.narrative: 1.3. advocacy - HRO/Ds conduct joint as well as individual advocacy in relevant fora, including the UN, EU and EU member states as well as in South Mediterranean countries, making use of the joint documentation products to promote human rights values in national and regional reform processes.

1.3. advocacy - HRO/Ds conduct joint as well as individual advocacy in relevant fora, including the UN, EU and EU member states as well as in South Mediterranean countries, making use of the joint documentation products to promote human rights values in national and regional reform processes.

comment.narrative: HRO/Ds hardly, or on an ad hoc basis engage with regional instruments to promote/protect human rights values in relation to national and regional reform processes.

description.narrative: 1.4. monitoring & documentation - HRO/Ds conduct joint monitoring and documentation and information sharing in relation to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.
1.4. monitoring & documentation - HRO/Ds conduct joint monitoring and documentation and information sharing in relation to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

comment.narrative: HRO/Ds hardly, or on an ad hoc basis engage conduct joint monitoring and information sharing in relation to the 5 key thematic areas.

description.narrative: 2.1. networking & dialogue - 3 to 4 priority areas and/or thematics of work identified in the beginning of each year through a consensus of the main civil society actors in Tunisia; Key CSOs from all over Tunisia are engaged in regular meetings with a view to mobilize the Tunisian civil society around the civil society forum;

2.1. networking & dialogue - 3 to 4 priority areas and/or thematics of work identified in the beginning of each year through a consensus of the main civil society actors in Tunisia; Key CSOs from all over Tunisia are engaged in regular meetings with a view to mobilize the Tunisian civil society around the civil society forum;

comment.narrative: 2.1 There is little tradition in engaging in political processes, as well as coordinating between historical associations while new associations spread throughout the country and need skills to impose themselves.

description.narrative: 2.2. capacity-building - training sessions are targetting mainly the newly established organisations in the disadvantaged regions, identified through field visits.
2.2. capacity-building - training sessions are targetting mainly the newly established organisations in the disadvantaged regions, identified through field visits.

comment.narrative: For the large number of organisations which have emerged in the wake of the Tunisian revolution - especially for newly established organizations and those based in disadvantaged areas -, there is a significant need for capacity building, in particular on networking and advocacy.

description.narrative: 2.3. advocacy - Tunisian CSOs are engaged in a regular dialogue with relevant officials and advocacy initiatives on EU-Tunisia relations.
2.3. advocacy - Tunisian CSOs are engaged in a regular dialogue with relevant officials and advocacy initiatives on EU-Tunisia relations.

comment.narrative: The Tunisian civil society is showing its commitment and capability to play a major role in the promotion and protection of human rights and the achievement of the Revolution objectives. As EU-Tunisia relations are entering a new chapter with a revision of the ENP, and as the EU has expressed its intention to engage in a structured dialogue with the civil society, there is a need for Tunisian CSOs to engage in the instruments, objectives and priorities of the EU-Tunisia relations and acquire the necessary skills to do so. In this context, the EMHRN can play a key role in helping Tunisian CSOs in developing joint advocacy initiatives and providing relevant documentation on the most pressing human rights issues.

description.narrative: NA
NA

SO1.1. Key outcome indicator 1: Regional. European and South Mediterranean human rights organisations and activists are able to meet, network, strategize together and conduct joint actions, including monitoring, documentation, solidarity and advocacy on human rights standards and violations.
Result: Of the total 524* representatives of HROs/HRDs who participated in EuroMed Rights' Working Group meetings, seminars, trainings, advocacy actions, and monitoring and documentation work in relation to regional networking and dialogue on the shrinking space for civil sociey, gender equality and women's rights, migration and asylum, the Middle East conflict, and Economic and Social rights, at least 75 % of those who responded to an evaluation (survey or oral evaluation) stated that they were satisfied or very satisfied with the benefits they gained from their participation.

SO1.1. Key outcome indicator 1: Regional. European and South Mediterranean human rights organisations and activists are able to meet, network, strategize together and conduct joint actions, including monitoring, documentation, solidarity and advocacy on human rights standards and violations.
Result: Of the total 524* representatives of HROs/HRDs who participated in EuroMed Rights' Working Group meetings, seminars, trainings, advocacy actions, and monitoring and documentation work in relation to regional networking and dialogue on the shrinking space for civil sociey, gender equality and women's rights, migration and asylum, the Middle East conflict, and Economic and Social rights, at least 75 % of those who responded to an evaluation (survey or oral evaluation) stated that they were satisfied or very satisfied with the benefits they gained from their participation.

comment.narrative: Local HROs are in need of means for meetings/ encounters between European or other South and East Med CSOs to build alliances in order to develop joint human rights responses to regional political developments and policies in a volatile Euro-Mediterranean region.

description.narrative:
Tunisian CSOs are able to network, share experiences, develop and conduct joint actions, including through flexible partnerships with EMHRN.
Result: 4437 Tunisian HRDs from different regions in Tunisia participated in joint events with EuroMed Rights within the fields of EU-Tunisia relations, justice reform, women's rights, eco-soc rights and migration. At least 50 events were done in partnership with or through support to EuroMed Rights partners. Through several field missions to the regions, new organisations were supported and included in networking activities. A meeting in January with key partners confirmed that the thematic priorities identified in 2015 were still the most relevant to continue in 2016 and they were throughout the year discussed at coordination meetings with partners and members. CSOs involved in partnerships with EuroMed Rights were further able to exchange experience, build capacity in relation to EU-Tunisia relations with regards to these themes.

Tunisian CSOs are able to network, share experiences, develop and conduct joint actions, including through flexible partnerships with EMHRN.
Result: 4437 Tunisian HRDs from different regions in Tunisia participated in joint events with EuroMed Rights within the fields of EU-Tunisia relations, justice reform, women's rights, eco-soc rights and migration. At least 50 events were done in partnership with or through support to EuroMed Rights partners. Through several field missions to the regions, new organisations were supported and included in networking activities. A meeting in January with key partners confirmed that the thematic priorities identified in 2015 were still the most relevant to continue in 2016 and they were throughout the year discussed at coordination meetings with partners and members. CSOs involved in partnerships with EuroMed Rights were further able to exchange experience, build capacity in relation to EU-Tunisia relations with regards to these themes.

comment.narrative: Tunisia is experiencing a process of democratic reforms, around which an emerging civil society needs capacities to mobilize and engage in the build-up of democratic institutions that are respectful of human rights.
